DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Probiotics , Lactobacillus , may effective prevent infection patient suppress immune system . PURPOSE : This phase I trial study side effect well give enteral nutrition , include Lactobacillus , work prevent infection patient undergo donor stem cell transplant hematologic cancer myelodysplastic syndrome .
DOC.brief_title: Lactobacillus Preventing Infection Patients Undergoing Donor Stem Cell Transplant Hematologic Cancer Myelodysplastic Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine patient treated probiotic-containing diet develop infection one probiotic microorganism undergo allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation hematologic malignancy myelodysplastic syndrome . OUTLINE : Patients receive oral Lactobacillus rhamosus GG ( Culturelle DS ) daily begin blood count recover without filgrastim ( G-CSF ) sargramostim ( GM-CSF ) support 3 consecutive day continue 1 year transplantation .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Currently undergo allogeneic stem cell transplantation relate unrelated donor hematologic malignancy myelodysplastic syndrome Hematopoietic engraftment evidence recovery absolute neutrophil count > 1000/μL > 3 day without filgrastim ( GCSF ) support within 30 day transplant PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : ECOG performance status 02 Serum creatinine ≤ 2.0 AST ALT ≤ 3 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) Total bilirubin ≤ 2.0 time ULN No clostridium difficile enterocolitis diagnose transplant hospitalization peritransplant period Able take medication mouth No evidence graftvshost disease No history inflammatory bowel disease chronic diarrheal illness No history hypersensitivity milk proteins PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics More 3 month since prior use probiotic supplement , exclude yogurt cheese live culture No concurrent overthecounter medication herbal remedy
